bullets.text: Bitcoin rallies near all-time high, gaining safe-haven bid during U.S. government shutdown uncertainty.
Record bullish options trading accompanies market’s grind higher, signaling elevated risk appetite and potential fragility.
Goldman Sachs CEO warns a market drawdown is likely, cautioning investors that “people won’t feel good” when momentum breaks.
Berkshire Hathaway separates chairman and CEO roles, paving way for Greg Abel’s succession, formalizing post-Buffett governance.
AI chipmaker Cerebras withdraws IPO, underscoring choppy issuance environment for hardware-centric AI plays despite sector hype.
Walmart-backed OnePay to add crypto in its banking app, signaling deepening mainstream financial integration of digital assets.
Hitachi shares jump over 10% on OpenAI partnership, highlighting investor enthusiasm for AI collaborations powering digital transformation.
Massive fire at Chevron’s California refinery raises near-term supply risks and potential regional fuel price pressure.
U.S. EV sales hit records led by Tesla and GM; analysts expect 2026 to be “year of the used EV.”
Wealth of the top 1% reaches record $52 trillion, reinforcing widening inequality and asset-price dependency in the U.S. economy.
Student loan borrowers face repayment plan access backlogs, risking consumer spending drag and delinquency as payments restart.
Putin warns of a “new stage of escalation” if U.S. supplies long-range missiles to Ukraine, increasing geopolitical risk premia.
Hamas signals willingness to release Gaza hostages amid intense political pressure on Netanyahu, potentially shifting cease-fire dynamics.
Lipid metabolism may fuel Alzheimer’s progression, suggesting new therapeutic targets for neurodegeneration.
New mechanism explaining cancer immunotherapy failure identified, offering paths to boost response rates across tumors.
